intro: Dichromena corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered dichromena, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rutaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Dichromena corymbosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
